Low haemoglobin concentrations indicative of moderate or severe anaemia during pregnancy 
have been associated with an increased risk of premature delivery, maternal and child mortality, 
and infectious diseases. Growth and development may also be affected, both in utero and in the 
long term. Conversely, haemoglobin concentrations greater than 130 g/l at sea level may also be
